text: I love this!!! Glad you are accommodating 🙌

It’s about time restaurants, coffee shops, hawker centers think about how to incentivize people to bring their own containers but then, I know of many people who just want the convenience of eating out of the box and throwing everything again in one go. Even if restaurants are using biodegradable food packaging, our waste management system in Singapore is not set up for that; everything (with the exception of things that can be recycled) gets incinerated and biodegradable boxes end up in the incinerators as well. Perhaps it’s about time that the restaurant industry looks into a solution that can truly incentivize customers to bring their own containers. 
https://www.todayonline.com/world/plastic-piles-thailand-pandemic-efforts-sideline-pollution-fight-2

answers.text: @nomadicexpat Unfortunately it’s a lifestyle decision. The inventive does very little to motivate customers to bring their own containers. Just as in supermarkets, many charge for bags but people rather pay than bring their own eco bags. Let’s educate and encourage 😊.
